page.title: 16Sunderland Point/Farming.
page.content: All the land not occupied by houses and gardens is intensively managed grassland now forming part of a farm to the North, Sunderland Brows. The fields of about 5 acres are separated by cob (earth) banks, hawthorn hedges, or stone walls. Most fields are permanent pasture; several meadows are cut for hay or silage once or twice each summer. The farm is mixed dairy and beef, stocked almost entirely with Friesian or Friesian cross cattle which graze the pasture during the summer months and are housed inside during the winter. The farm makes a small delivery of untreated bottled milk to the village, but most of the milk is sold in bulk for treatment, processing, and resale.
